results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/28]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. A new assembly - France has gone to the polls to elect her new national Assembly. 2. Polar missions - high and low altitude parachuting to supply the French Polar bases in Greenland. 3. The Grand Prix de Paris - the Grand Prix at Longchamps race-course. 4. The Arts - new rooms in Paris’ Carnavalet Museum, devoted to 18th century French furniture.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/27]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. France goes to the polls - the first round of the legislative elections has resulted in sharp Gaullist gains. 2. From atop the “Imperial” - New “imperial” type two-decker buses are put to use in Paris. 3. 14th July - France on parade. 4. The Andre Masson exhibition - an exhibition of Andre Masson’s works at a gallery near the Seine River.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/25]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Towards resumption of normal activities in France - After a general strike, and with resumption of activities in many sectors, France is looking her normal self again. 2. In the news: The Salon de Mai (May Salon) Painting Exhibition. The Fontenay aux Roses Electrical Research Center. 3. Women and sports - Dany Duflot, world water-ski champion; Claude Mandonnaud, European 400 meter free-style swimming champion; Nicole Bera, French parachute champion. 4. Notre Dame de Paris - Eight centuries have gone by since Maurice de Sully decided to have Notre Dame built. Although Paris has changed faces, the cathedral has stood unchanged through the ages, a world centre of faith.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/21]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. What is at stake in the French elections - The events leading up the dissolution of the French National Assembly and making ready for the new legislative elections. 2. Techniques - 765,000 volt circuit-breakers for the US. Near Paris, finishing touches on a revolutionary combustion-cell. 3. School for aces - Test Pilots’ School: routine coasting-tests for transport with feathered engines. The arts - Pierre-Yves Tremois, one of the best French engravers of the modern school.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/18]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The Comparison Salon - For the organisers of the Comparison Salon, faithful to the guiding principles uniting them, it is necessary to adapt to the changes of an art in perpetual movement. 2. Marshal Foch - France paid a solemn tribute to Marshal Foch on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of his nomination as Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces during World War One. 3. The lovers of Provence - Many are the lovers of Provence, with its flowers blowing in the breeze, with its fragrant forests, and with its criss-crossing streams glistening. 4. Decorations and forms - In 1900, on every street corner, paris discovered an art with fluid forms…it was called “art nouveau”. 5. “Do’s and don’ts” for tourists - You cannot help but enjoy your stay in the French capital, on the one condition that you know the mores.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/17]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The Eighth of May 1945 - An evocation by Monsieur Maurice Schumann, former spokesman for the “Free French”. 2. Industrial cooperation - Unveiling a new Franco-British jet trainer - the Jaguar. 3. Holy Week - A nocturnal Easter procession at Sauges in the Massif Central. 4. The arts - Antoine Watteau exhibition in Paris.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/16]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Dam across the Ain River - A wall of concrete, over a million and a half cubic feet of it, now stretches across the valley of the Ain in the Jura. Water has begun fillin an immense reservoir which will form a lake of some 600 square miles in area. 2. At the Elysee Palace - the Prime Minister of Lybia was received by General de Gaulle at the Elysee Palace. 3. Speaking of transplants - At Lyons, Doctor Marius Barnard and Doctor Botha - the brother and the assistant of the man to make the first successful heart transplant - visited the Pasteur Institute. 4. Rene Leduc: aviation wizard - Rene Leduc, one of the pioneers in supersonic aviation, inventor of state-reactor engine capable of speeds of over a thousand miles an hour, dies. 5. A pavillion in Osaka - Chosen in an open competition, France’s pavillion at the Japanese World Fair will be inflatable. 6. An artist named Brassai - Brassai, famous for his photographs, proves to

results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Hungarian President visits France. 2. Hirson (Aisne) - A wig factory which dominates the world market for artificial hair pieces. 3.
